definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The wolf jumped up and swallowed up Little Red Riding Hood.
sentences.chinese: 大灰狼跳起来把小红帽吃了下去。

sentences.english: A big wolf suddenly jumped out of the bed.
sentences.chinese: 一直大灰狼突然从床上蹦起。

sentences.english: So the wolf huffed and puffed and blew down the house of sticks.
sentences.chinese: 于是，大灰狼鼓起肚子，一口气又吹倒了木头屋子。

sentences.english: The big bad wolf also got to the third little pig's door quicky.
sentences.chinese: 大灰狼好快就追到去猪三屋企。

sentences.english: Storyteller:SO the wolf from the chimney straight slipped into a hot pan.
sentences.chinese: 于是大灰狼从烟囱顶就直接滑进了热水锅里面。

sentences.english: Three piggies try very hard to of run, but still is caught up by the big ash wolf.
sentences.chinese: 三只小猪拼命的跑，但是还是被大灰狼追上了。

sentences.english: This time I wasn't theone who heard the thumping of the lobo 's tail.
sentences.chinese: 这次不仅我一个人听到了大灰狼尾巴的砰砰声。

sentences.english: It features Wolfie getting away from Grandma and returning to the nightclub.
sentences.chinese: 结局是大灰狼最终离开奶奶回到夜总会。

sentences.english: The big wolf of ash has to come after the white wolf, arriving his home together.
sentences.chinese: 大灰狼只好跟着白狼，一起到他家去。

sentences.english: After a while, the wolf comes.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，大灰狼来了。

sentences.english: No, no! You are a wolf.
They were prepared to fight the fiercest panther or a pack of lobo .
sentences.chinese: 他们准备和最凶猛的黑豹或一群大灰狼拼斗。

sentences.english: But next to the baby lay the dog-like body of a large wolf.
sentences.chinese: 但是在他的身边躺着一条像狗一样的大灰狼的尸体。

sentences.english: The baby rabbits tells her about the wolf.
sentences.chinese: 小兔们跟她说起了大灰狼的事。

definition: queer uncle, referring to a young to middle-aged male pedophile (Internet slang)
